title: Look inside Back Bay’s Sheraton Boston after a $100 million renovation
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Sheraton Boston in Back Bay unveiled a $100 million renovation for its 60th anniversary, revamping guest rooms and public spaces.
The renovation features historic tavern-inspired lobbies, redesigned rooms with skyline views, and updated event spaces.
New amenities include a retractable roof pool deck, a state-of-the-art fitness studio, and the exclusive Sheraton Club for Marriott Bonvoy members.

title: Insider predicts how Alex Bregman, Trevor Story will handle player options with Red Sox this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Bregman may opt out of his Red Sox contract, with rumors of a lucrative offer from other teams.
Trevor Story is expected to opt in, remaining with the Red Sox for the final two years of his contract.
If Bregman leaves, Marcelo Mayer could replace him, reshaping the Red Sox's infield for the 2026 season.

title: Roman Anthony played a big role getting the Red Sox into playoff position. It’s on the veterans to play into October.
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Roman Anthony, with a .336/.439/.564 slash line in 132 plate appearances, suffered a left oblique strain against the Guardians.
Anthony's oblique injury, sidelining him for 4-6 weeks, comes amid the Red Sox's strong playoff positioning turnaround.
With Anthony out, veterans like Trevor Story and Masataka Yoshida need to step up to maintain Red Sox's playoff momentum.

title: Review: ‘The Paper’ shows promise, even as ‘The Office’ legacy looms large
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Paper,' a spinoff of NBC's 'The Office,' is streaming its first season on Peacock.
Domhnall Gleeson stars as the optimistic editor-in-chief of the fictional newspaper, The Toledo Truth Teller.
The show highlights the struggles of modern journalism, with comedic nods to its predecessor's format.

title: Randy Moss opened up about cancer battle, support he received, and helping Deion Sanders
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Randy Moss revealed his diagnosis with Stage 2 bile-duct cancer in late 2024; he is now in remission.
Moss underwent a complex six-hour procedure, chemotherapy, and radiation as part of his cancer treatment.
Moss supported Deion Sanders during Sanders's cancer battle, finding personal solace in helping a friend.

title: 2 young adults killed in midday N.H. crash
author: John Waller
bullets: A 25-year-old woman and an 18-year-old man from Barrington were killed in a three-vehicle crash in Barrington, N.H.
The crash occurred at 1 p.m. Wednesday at the intersection of Route 125 and Newtown Plains Road.
An 83-year-old woman was hospitalized with injuries; the crash involved two passenger vehicles and a commercial vehicle.

title: Woman who ran over pedestrian at South Bay Mall had 15 used needles in handbag, authorities say
author: John Waller
bullets: Ariella Bezan, 25, charged for running over a woman at South Bay Mall, allegedly under drug influence.
Used needles and drug paraphernalia found in Bezan's car following the incident in Dorchester.
Victim sustained non-life-threatening injuries; Bezan's arraignment set bail at $1,500, court date on Sept. 24.

title: Should we hope that Mike Vrabel’s debut as Patriots coach goes as well as Jerod Mayo’s did? Actually, yes.
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Vrabel will debut as Patriots head coach against the Raiders at Gillette Stadium on a Sunday afternoon.
Jerod Mayo's single-season coaching for the Patriots ended with a 4-13 record following an initial victory in 2024.
Patriots and Raiders both aim for improved seasons following 4-13 records; Raiders bring Pete Carroll as coach.

title: A Mass. historical home tour just ranked the best in the U.S.
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: The House of the Seven Gables in Salem ranked the best historical home tour in the U.S. by Newsweek.
Built in 1668, the mansion was the inspiration for Nathaniel Hawthorne's 1851 novel, The House of the Seven Gables.
Tours are $25 in September, $30 in October, with over 100,000 visitors annually to the National Historic Landmark.

title: 10 burning questions about the 2025 Patriots ahead of their season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots debut a new era under coach Mike Vrabel with a revamped roster and schemes for the 2025 NFL season.
Drake Maye returns with new support including Stefon Diggs, but questions about turnovers and receiver performance remain.
Christian Gonzalez's hamstring injury and Will Campbell's rookie season are key concerns as the Patriots face the Raiders.
